episode_title: 717 - The One With The Cheap Wedding Dress

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey are there. Monica is holding a piece of paper.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So the wedding caterer sent me this list of twelve appetizers and I have to narrow it down to six.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Food? Uh-huh gimme! (She hands him the paper.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So did Monica tell you about this great band called the Swing Kings that we’re trying to get to play at the wedding?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Since when are you into swing music?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh since forever! I used to go all over town listening to bands!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Gap commercial. (To Monica) So did you book them? Did you call?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I will.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you want me to call?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I’ll do it. You just stick to your job.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is your job?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Staying out of the way.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is impossible Monica, why don’t you just pick all 15? (Hands back the paper.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There were only twelve.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, I added three.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are peanut butter fingers?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah… (He mimes sticking his fingers into a jar of peanut butter, scooping some out, and eating it off his fingers.)

content.description: A Street, Chandler and Ross are at a newsstand.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well hello! She’s cute! Should we uh, go try to talk to her?
content.parenthetical: noticing a beautiful woman moving in down the street

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure! That’s one of the great things about being engaged. I’m not nervous talking to pretty girls anymore.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Could you guys help me? (Chandler shyly exhales and looks away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh yeah! Let me, let me get that for you.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: It-it’s really heavy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got it. (He lifts the box and grunts under the strain.) (Calmly) So hi, I’m uh, I’m Ross and this is my friend Chandler. (He shyly waves.)

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: I-I am Kristen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Kristen, hi. Are you uh, new to the area, ‘cause if you are…I’d love to show you around sometime.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: I…I uh, actually just moved from four blocks over.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: But-but this block is like a whole other world.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know actually it does have a very interesting history. Uh, this street is the first street in the city to have an underground sewer system. (Kristen crinkles her nose at that.) Before that sewage and waste would just flow right down the street. Yeah, sometimes ankle deep! (He stops when he realizes what he’s talking about.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Smooth.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Excuse me? (Chandler does the shy thing again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, say you’re gonna be starving after all this moving. What do you say I take you to dinner tonight?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Oh I’d like that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great! Uh, let me take this up for you. (The box he’s holding.)

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: After you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no-no, after you. (She grabs a chair and heads upstairs.) (When she’s gone.) Oh my God! (He drops the box and Chandler can’t pick it up.)

content.description: A Bridal Shop, Phoebe and Rachel are waiting for Monica who is trying on her wedding dress.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Am I crazy or does this totally go?!
(Monica enters from the dressing room wearing her gown.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! You look so beautiful!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you Rachel but, look at Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is it. Yeah, this is the one. I can’t believe I found it!
(Another woman walks up.)

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: Wow you look so beautiful! If I knew you, I’d cry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I’m Monica Geller, ball like a baby.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: I’m Megan Bailey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you found your dress yet?

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Oh no, these dresses are all so amazing but there is no way I could afford one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I can’t afford this either. No. I-I-I’m, I’m just here to figure out which one I want then I’m gonna get it at Kleinman’s, this discount place in Brooklyn, day after tomorrow they are having a huge sale.

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Oh, thanks for the tip.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! So-so when are you getting married?

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Oh I’m not, I just like to try these on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I do the same thing.

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: I’m just kidding. I’m getting married July 25 th .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just kidding too. (Laughs) I’m getting married in December. (Turns away not happy with herself.)

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: So when are you getting married?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh May 15 th .

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Oooh it’s getting close!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: So uh, who’s your photographer?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Jeffery.

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: We met with him. Did he show you the photos of the nude wedding he did?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The best man? Wow!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: I know! I almost called off my wedding. Oh, who’s your band?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, my fiancee wants the Swing Kings.

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Oh, you’re so lucky. My fiancee wants the heavy metal band Carcass.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, is that spelled with a ‘C’ or a ‘K’? Oh my God! It doesn’t matter; they’re both great!
(Another woman walks past Rachel carrying a wedding dress.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh y’know what? Y’know what? Now that you know what you want you should go to Kleinman’s and get it half off. This place is so overpriced.

content.speaker: The Woman
content.text: I own this store.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, does this (the dress) come in another color or… (The store owner walks away.)

content.description: A Street, Joey is walking by Kristen, who is still moving in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi! You uh, movin’ in or movin’ out?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: I’m moving in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, can I give you a hand?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Oh okay. But y’know what? Be careful. Because a guy who was helping me before had to leave because he hurt his back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Boyfriend?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m Joey. (They shake hands.)

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Kristen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wow, what a beautiful name! (Pause) What is it again?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Kristen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Got it! (He picks up a lamp.) So…

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: So uh, do you live around here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! Right down there. (Points.) Hey listen; let me give you a little tip. Do not take a nap on this stoop (Points to hers) or you can wake up with your shoes gone.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: I’ll remember that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Yeah. Listen would you uh, would you like to have dinner with me tonight?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Oh I, I have plans tonight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: But how about tomorrow?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sounds great! Okay, alright, well where does this go? (The lamp he’s holding.)

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: You look strong, why don’t I take that and you grab one of the boxes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Yeah. (She leaves and he goes to pick up a box marked books, but decides to take the box marked pillows instead.) Yeah, I’ll grab this one. (He follows her upstairs.)

content.description: Kleinman’s, a horde of women including Rachel, Phoebe, and Monica are waiting for the store to open.

content.speaker: A Woman
content.text: What is taking so long?! I mean whatever!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So this is Brooklyn.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, listen up. There is usually only one dress in each size so when they open those doors, fan out. Now, this is what you’re looking for! (Holds up a picture of it.) Memorize it! When you locate the dress, blow on these. All right? (She passes out whistles to them.) Three short blasts. When you hear it, come running.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Got it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right.
(A worker comes to open the door and the horde starts to press forward.)

content.speaker: A Woman
content.text: Here he comes! Hurry!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh they’re pushing! They’re pushing!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Don’t be a baby!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I…
(The door opens allowing the horde to charge in, knocking Rachel out of the way and to the ground.)

content.speaker: A Woman
content.text: Let’s go!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Rachel! Come on!!!!
[Time lapse, inside the store, Monica is frantically looking for her dress.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. No. Not it. Not it. Not it. (Checks another rack and another woman tries to reach around her.) (To the woman) Don’t crowd me! (Finds it) This is it! This is the dress! Oh my God, it’s perfect! (She takes it off of the rack and someone has a hold of it on the other side of the rack and tugs on it.) I’m sorry, this one’s taken! (The other woman tugs harder pulling Monica through the rack.) Whoa!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Megan!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You came?!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is my dress!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes it is! You saw me wearing it!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: And now you’ll see me buying it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? You freak! You wouldn’t even have known about this place if it wasn’t for me!

content.speaker: Megan
content.text: Look, you don’t want to fight me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe I do! I’m pretty feisty! (She blows the signal.)
[Cut to Phoebe in another part of the store.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m coming! I’m coming! (She takes off towards the signal and almost knocks another woman over.)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hey!
(She hears another signal in another direction.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! (Runs that way and hears another whistle blast.) Hey! (Heads the other way and hears another blast.) What do I do?!! (She runs in the second direction and finds that the whistling is coming from inside a rack. She moves the dresses out of the way to find Rachel curled up in a fetal position frantically blowing on the whistle.) What are you doing? (Rachel doesn’t stop.) Did you find the dress? (Rachel won’t stop so Phoebe pinches her nose shut which causes her to spit the whistle out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did you find the dress?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! You gotta get me out of here Phoebe! These bargain shoppers are crazy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I—We gotta get Monica. (She starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! You gotta hold my hand!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!! (She grabs Rachel’s hand and drags her towards Monica.) Excuse me! Excuse me! (She’s knocking women and veils out of the way as she moves.)
(She gets to Monica who has the dress balled up in one hand and is sitting on Megan who is sprawled out on the floor.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Go! Go! Go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: NOW!!!!!!!! (Rachel runs off and Monica gets up to follow her.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So Ross, how was your date the other night? Did you tell her about the magical ride that starts with the flush of every toilet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Laugh all you want but uh, she actually left me a message saying she’d like to go out again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah in fact, I’m gonna go call her right now. And I’ll make sure to tell her my friend Chandler says… (He mimics the shy reaction Chandler did.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, sorry I didn’t stop by last night but I had a date.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh Joe, when it’s one o’clock in the morning and you don’t come by? That’s okay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well check it out, I was with this really hot girl who just moved in right across the street!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Right across the street?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When’d you meet her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Two days ago.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excellent! Y’know Ross met somebody too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! How’d it go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh great! We’re going out again Saturday. But I just found she’s also seeing some other guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?! Joe? What would you do if you were in Ross’s situation?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I sorta am. I mean yeah, I’m dating this girl who’s also seeing another guy. But, I don’t know, I’m not too worried about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well you shouldn’t be. Believe me I wouldn’t want to be the guy who’s up against you. (Chandler laughs.) I mean that doofus is going to lose!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So this is nice! I wish I didn’t have to go, believe me! But unfortunately I have to. (He gets up and Joey moves over next to Ross.) Oh uh, by the way, what’s the name of the girl you’re dating?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Kristen Lang.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye! (Exits.)

content.description: Central Perk, time lapse from the earlier scene.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well obviously only one of us can keep dating her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Obviously! So, how do we decide?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well now let’s-let’s look at this objectively, I think I should date her…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Or , or I’m the one who dates her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s interesting, but check this out. I date her…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah I like that but just to go in another direction…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay. This can go on for a while.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah well we should order some food then.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No Joey! Look why don’t, why don’t we just let her decide? Okay? Hey-hey, we’ll each go out with her one more time. And-and we’ll see who she likes best.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That sounds fair.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe I’ll take her to that new French restaurant down the street…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah yeah—wait a second now! Look we’re gonna have to set a spending limit on the date. I don’t have the money to take her to a fancy place like that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well sorry, that’s what I do on dates.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, well I guess I’ll just have to do what I do on dates.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So let’s decide on the spending limit…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Uh, (thinks)…a slice…(Thinks)…six dollars?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was thinking more like a hundred.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Can I borrow 94 dollars?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are admiring Monica’s wedding dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. Hand me a tissue. (Monica hands her one.)
(Rachel goes to the fridge, opens it, and blows on the whistle Monica gave her at the store, which causes Phoebe and Monica to turn around and look at her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re out of Diet Coke .
(The phone rings and Monica answers it as Rachel goes into the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens) What?! (Listens) You what?! (Listens) Hey you listen here missy! (Listens) Wh—(She is hung up on.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was that girl Megan! She booked the Swing Kings on the day of our wedding and said that I couldn’t have them back unless I gave her the dress!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does that mean Carcass is available?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What am I gonna do?! That is the dress! That is the dress! Wh…Chandler wants the band. What do I do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well just figure out a way to talk him out of it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How?
(There are three short whistle blasts from the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re out of toilet paper!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is getting ready for his date with Kristen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just wanted to come by and y’know, wish you good luck on your date.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh thanks!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. What time are you meeting her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We have 8:00 reservations at Gramercy Bistro.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, that’s in like 20 minutes. You’d better get dressed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am dressed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. Well good! (To himself) For me. (He picks up a jar of lotion.) What is this? Did you give yourself a facial?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have an oily T-zone!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay dude! (Finds a receipt.) Hey you uh, you sent Kristen flowers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You spent a hundred dollars. That’s the limit. You’re screwed!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh actually, I sent the flowers before the actual date. So technically, technically I didn’t break any rules. Thanks for stopping by though.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh! So that’s the way it’s gonna be huh? Yeah I can break the rules too y’know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah? What are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why am I not surprised?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what Ross? I’m not gonna let you get away with this!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t think you have much choice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well we’ll see!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye-bye!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah bye-bye! (Exits and comes back in still holding the lotion.) Hey! So just a light layer?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes. Just here (Runs his fingers down the bridge of his nose) and there (Runs his fingers across his forehead).

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is entering without touching anything with his hands. Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey got meat sauce on the banister again! (He goes into the bathroom to wash his hands.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, swing music is so out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, he’s gotta be in the room for that to work.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you guys talking about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well umm, we were just talking about the y’know, the Swing Kings and just wondering whether y’know, they were the right way to go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I went to a wedding once where they had swing music and uh, two months later the couple got divorced. And now I’m not saying that there’s any connection here y’know, but they did tell me that’s why they got divorced.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I love swing music!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah but the Swing Kings? Y’know they suck so much that people actually die at their concerts—They just stop living.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look all I know is when Monica and I went to see them, we had fun! And there’s another reason too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what is the other reason?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t want to say.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well you have to because maybe it’s stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it’s just while Monica and I were dancing to them it was…the first time I knew that…you were the woman I wanted to dance all my dances with.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh crap!

content.description: Gramercy Bistro, Ross and Kristen are waiting for their table to be ready. Ross is returning from talking to the Maitre d’.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So they said our table will be ready in just a few minutes.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Oh great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Is your back feeling better?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah it’s fine. I guess the more muscles you have the more they can spasm out of control.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kristen?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Hi! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh I like this place. And technically, technically I’m not breaking any rules so I…

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Well uh, Ross? This is Joey. Joey? Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. (They shake hands.) It’s nice to meet you. I used to have a friend named Joey. I don’t anymore.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Our table will be ready in a couple minutes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. So…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! I would love to wait with you guys! Thanks! (Sits down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Joey umm, you look familiar. Are uh, are you on TV or something?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Well Joey doesn’t like to talk about it but, he’s one of the stars of Days Of Our Lives .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right! That’s right, don’t you play a woman?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A woman in a man’s body.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Much better.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So y’know Ross it’s funny ‘cause, you look familiar to me too. Have you ever been married?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well yes, yes I have. In fact umm, just the other day Kristen and I were talking about how I’ve been married and how I have a son.

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Yeah, little Eric.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right! Wait no, Ben.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you’ve just married the one time then?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well umm…

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: You’ve been married twice?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. And another time after that. Boy I’m getting hungry! Hey Joey, have you ever been so hungry on a date that when a girl goes to the bathroom you ate some of her food?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: You said the waiter ate my crab cake.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. So uh Ross, well now—why did that first marriage breakup? Was it because the woman was straight or she was a lesbian?

content.speaker: Kristen
content.text: Do you two know each other?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: No. No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. It just seems like Ross is the kind of a guy that would marry a woman on the verge of being a lesbian and then push her over the edge.
(Kristen is not enjoying this.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute! Were you on a poster for gonorrhea?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Have you ever slept in the same bed as a monkey?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey you leave Marcel out of this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! Have you ever got stuck in a pair of your own leather pants?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey have you ever locked yourself in a TV cabinet VD boy?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monkey lover!
(They both notice that Kristen has left.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When do you think we lost her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Probably around gonorrhea.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is entering.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, honey! I’m home!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t come in here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why? Do you have another boyfriend in there or something?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! We only mess around at his place!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know it’s funny I started it but, now it’s scaring me. So could you come out here please?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I’m wearing a wedding dress.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh you got a wedding dress? That’s great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah but I’m not keeping it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well then why can’t I see it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. I guess you can. Okay but; I-I have to return it, so you can’t like it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay I promise. I’ll-I’ll hate it. (She enters.) Wow! You-you look…hideous.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, that’s like the most ugliest dress I’ve ever seen. Wh-why do you have to return it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh because it doesn’t…really fit. Oh by the way, I-I booked the Swing Kings.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s great! Great! Thanks! But that dress I mean it’s like yuck! It’s terrible! It makes me wanna just rip it right off of you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! But you can’t rip it. Well, maybe a little.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are watching a basketball game on the couch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys! Do you wanna look at the song list for the wedding? (They ignore her.) Guys?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought you were gonna be gone all day.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, what’s going on?
(They all slowly turn around to reveal that they are giving themselves a facial.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I-I should probably leave you girls alone. (She heads for the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, laugh all you want but in ten minutes we’re gonna have younger looking skin!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! (Monica goes in the bedroom.) Y’know, she could use a little…(Whistles that she needs to do what they’re doing.) (Something happens on the game.) Oh nice shot!!! (They all cheer.)
